alert.note: Alert for Washtenaw (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 11 at 4:15AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Washtenaw County through 515 AM EDT... At 413 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Brooklyn, or 7 miles southeast of Jackson, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Chelsea around 440 AM EDT. Dexter around 450 AM EDT. Whitmore Lake around 505 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Hudson Mills, Delhi Mills, Pleasant Lake, Barton Hills, Lyndon Township and Hudson Mills Metropark. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
